Children are not professional models, nor even enthusiastic about posing. While children are inherently beautiful, they arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t naturals at sitting still. This creates a hurdle for photographers attempting to capture the personalities of younger, restless subjects. However, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not impossible to get a child to pose for the camera Ã¢â‚¬â€ you just have to speak their language.

After more than ten years of shooting, celebrated children's photographer Tamara Lackey has developed a language for effectively communicating with her younger clients. In this 3-day course, you will learn TamaraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s 10-point system designed to secure gorgeous, expressive images Ã¢â‚¬â€ including her formula for building to Ã¢â‚¬Å“the final shot.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
